episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including a man who posted himself in 1903, the world's oldest edible ham, orangutans using iPads, and a humorous entry for Wales in the 1888 Encyclopedia Britannica. The hosts delve into these topics with their usual humor and curiosity, exploring the oddities and trivia surrounding each fact.

facts.fact: In 1903, a man called W. Reginald Bray posted himself.
The oldest edible ham has just celebrated its 112th birthday.
Orangutans like playing on iPads, but gorillas do not.
The 1888 Encyclopedia Britannica entry for Wales reads "See England."
